metadata.title: CVE-2021-47476 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: comedi:ni_usb6501: fix NULL-deref in command paths The driver uses endpoint-sizedUSB transfer buffers but had no sanity checks on the sizes. This can leadto zero-size-pointer dereferences or overflowed transfer buffers inni6501_port_command() and ni6501_counter_command() if a (malicious) devicehas smaller max-packet sizes than expected (or when doing descriptor fuzztesting). Add the missing sanity checks to probe().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2060-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2060.62
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2060-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2060.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2042-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2042.46
